body: Agree, that's actually simpler. Done.
I don't like interfaces that populate output argument when failure occurs.
Ah agree on that.
utACK e11d7ea24b7c67793ab8e84b5ad05d233f43e7da

Maybe add a comment:
`// Check if origin information (master key fingerprint, derivation path) is present`

It's actually not obvious to me how this test checks that an origin string passed into the test is actually stored correctly.
In BIP32 this test vector is `m/0/2147483647'/1/2147483646'` derived from master seed `fffcf9f...`. It would be better to use that for the origin info.

```
warning: 'ONLY_EMPTY' is a static definition in anonymous namespace; static is redundant here [readability-static-definition-in-anonymous-namespace]
```

```
warning: function 'FlatSigningProvider::GetKeyOrigin' has a definition with different parameter names [readability-inconsistent-declaration-parameter-name]
```

```
warning: std::move of the variable 'key' of the trivially-copyable type 'CPubKey' has no effect; remove std::move() [hicpp-move-const-arg]
```

```
warning: std::move of the expression of the trivially-copyable type 'CPubKey' has no effect; remove std::move() [performance-move-const-arg]
```
Fixed.
Fixed.
Fixed.
Fixed.
Perhaps @achow101 can use this in #14021?
@Sjors I don't think this would be useful there. Instead we should have some new command that lets us import descriptors into the wallet.

```
2018-09-25 20:23:55 clang(pr=14150): script/descriptor.cpp:179:69: warning: implicit conversion changes signedness: 'int' to 'std::vector<unsigned int, std::allocator<unsigned int> >::value_type' (aka 'unsigned int') [-Wsign-conversion]
```
Added some comments.

Meh.

This is not testing BIP32; it's just reusing the BIP32 tests because that was an easy place to find example xpubs/xprvs.
Fixed.
Rebased, and expanded documentation to include key origin information.
Was there a problem with the last rebase? It seems like some changes that were previously made, like https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14150#discussion_r215631128, have been reverted.
Concept ACK, will wait for the rebase to be fixed before reviewing then

@ryanofsky Wow, indeed, thanks for pointing that out. I don't know how that happened.

I went through all comments again, and reapplied the fixed I made earlier where necessary. I've also expanded the documentation change a bit.
